medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain started approximately 15 hours prior to presentation, initially as generalized colicky pain that progressed to being localized to the RLQ. The patient also experienced nausea but no vomiting, fevers, chills, diarrhea, chest pain, or shortness of breath.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Denies past surgical history; has a history of vasectomy.
